comments.author: theopra@gmail.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 565347
firefoxIssue64bits.png

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; pt-BR; rv:1.9.2.8) Gecko/20100722 Firefox/3.6.8
Build ID: 20100722155716

Steps to reproduce:

Used a <input type="text" size="60" /> in Firefox 7.


Actual results:

When I open the page in Firefox 7, the component renders 20px more than Firefox 6 or older versions.


Expected results:

The component should have the same size in all versions of Firefox.
comments.creator: theopra@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; pt-BR; rv:1.9.2.8) Gecko/20100722 Firefox/3.6.8
Build ID: 20100722155716

Steps to reproduce:

Used a <input type="text" size="60" /> in Firefox 7.


Actual results:

When I open the page in Firefox 7, the component renders 20px more than Firefox 6 or older versions.


Expected results:

The component should have the same size in all versions of Firefox.

(In reply to Pedro Prá from comment #0)

> 
> When I open the page in Firefox 7, the component renders 20px more than
> Firefox 6 or older versions.

Your screenshot shows Firefox 7 x86 and Firefox 7 x64 but you say the difference is between Firefox 6 and 7. Which is the case?

BTW - please do not set the priority flag - this is for use by developers

comments.creator: theopra@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
No, sorry about de confusion.
The problem was begin at FireFox 7, I said the 6 version was working ok.

Does the same issue occur with Firefox 7 x86?

Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

How about with a new, empty profile? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic%20Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile
